channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: ‘Climbing is for ladies too’: Transforming Malawi into a climbers’ paradise
item.description: A small group of enterprising, local climbers has a bold cause - to attract more Malawians to the sport.

item.title: At least 14 dead, several missing in Indonesia flash floods, cold lava flow
item.description: Heavy rain triggers a flash flood and a cold lava flow from Mount Marapi, resulting in the disaster in West Sumatra.

item.title: NBA playoffs: Stars shine for Celtics, Mavericks in Game 3 victories
item.description: Celtics score 106-93 comeback win over Cavs, while Luka Doncic-led Mavericks beat OKC Thunder 105-101.

item.title: India Lok Sabha election 2024 Phase 4: Who votes and what’s at stake?
item.description: People from across 10 states and union territories will vote on May 13 to elect 96 MPs for the Lok Sabha.

item.title: Guardians of the glaciers – life alongside Pakistan’s vanishing ice
item.description: The rapid melting of Pakistan’s icy giants is creating hardships and challenges for vulnerable communities.

item.title: Thousands protest against Israel’s participation in Eurovision final
item.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters in Malmo, Sweden say Israel should be excluded over its conduct in its war on Gaza.

item.title: Russia claims capture of villages in northeast Ukraine amid renewed assault
item.description: Ukrainian officials say intensifying fighting in contested border areas has forced more than 1,700 civilians to flee.

item.title: What could sweeping UNGA support for Palestine’s full UN membership mean?
item.description: A total of 143 member nations voted in favour, reflecting global opinion on Israel's war on Gaza.

item.title: Solar storm produces stunning northern lights across US, UK, Russia
item.description: The powerful solar storm triggered spectacular celestial light shows in skies from the United States to the UK.

item.title: Hamas says a captive has died of wounds sustained in Israeli air strike
item.description: British-Israeli Nadav Popplewell was taken captive from Nirim kibbutz by Palestinian group Hamas on October 7.

item.title: Thousands flee Rafah after Israeli forces issue evacuation order
item.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians are being displaced once more by the most recent evacuation order.

item.title: Israeli army orders more evacuations from Rafah as it expands Gaza assault
item.description: Doctor pleads for protection as forced evacuation order is widened to include Rafah's Kuwaiti Hospital.

item.title: It is time to seek justice for environmental war crimes
item.description: Ukrainian efforts to document and prosecute atrocities linked to the environment can help with accountability elsewhere.

item.title: Mexico City is sinking, running out of water: How can it be saved?
item.description: The city faces 'Day Zero' as aquifers drain and pipes break. Meanwhile, costly workarounds don’t fix the real problem.

item.title: Israel bans Al Jazeera ahead of Rafah invasion
item.description: Israel bans and blocks Al Jazeera as Rafah - Gaza’s 'last safe space' - is invaded.

item.title: More than 300 killed in Afghanistan flash floods: WFP
item.description: Many others remain missing, with authorities scrambling to rescue the injured.

item.title: Keep calm and carry on: Ukraine’s Kharkiv holds tight under Russian fire
item.description: Residents say they won’t be cowed by latest offensive as life continues as usual.

item.title: Northern lights dazzle skygazers as ‘extreme’ solar storm hits Earth
item.description: Weather experts warn of potential disruptions to power grids, communications as sun's outburst continues in coming days.

item.title: Gaza’s mass graves: Is the truth being uncovered?
item.description: Calls for an independent inquiry are mounting as more burial sites are found across Gaza.

item.title: Political turmoil in Kuwait as emir dissolves parliament
item.description: Sheikh Mishal also announces the suspension of some articles of the constitution amid a continuing deadlock.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 807
item.description: As the war enters its 807th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: On 2nd anniversary of Abu Akleh killing, press advocates push for justice
item.description: Advocates say lack of accountability in Abu Akleh's killing reflects pattern of impunity in Israel's attacks on press.

item.title: This Indian historian fights the far right, one makeup video at a time
item.description: Ruchika Sharma combines her passion for history and eyeshadow, taking on myths about the past shaping India's present.

item.title: US report finds possible Israeli violations of international law in Gaza
item.description: Report says that incomplete information from Israel made it difficult to assess specific cases of possible violations.

item.title: South Africa asks ICJ to order Israel to withdraw from Gaza’s Rafah
item.description: South Africa seeks new emergency measures over Israel's latest offensive against the southern city in Gaza.
